alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 5:29PM EDT until July 16 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bristol County in southeastern Massachusetts... Plymouth County in southeastern Massachusetts... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Heavy rains over Rhode Island and southward into Long Island will move into the warned area over the next few hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low- lying areas. Sharp rises on streams and creeks to near or over bankfull can be expected. Urban flash flooding is possible in larger cities in the warned area, including but not limited to New Bedford, Fall River and Taunton. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Bedford, Brockton, Fall River, Plymouth, Taunton, Dartmouth, North Attleborough, Bridgewater, Marshfield, Marion, Attleboro, Mansfield, Middleborough, Easton, Wareham, Bourne, Norton, Somerset, Scituate and Pembroke. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
